text: "Gold Roses" is a song by American rapper Rick Ross featuring Canadian rapper Drake. It was released by Epic Records as the third single from Ross's album Port of Miami 2 on July 26, 2019. It follows Drake's "Money in the Grave" featuring Ross, which was released a month earlier in June 2019. The track contains samples from "Israël Suite", written by Sylvian Krief and Boris Bergman, and performed by Rupture. The song was nominated for a Grammy Award for Best Rap Song at the 62nd Annual Grammy Awards. ==Charts== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center" |- ! scope="col"| Chart (2019) ! scope="col"| Peak position |- ! scope="row"| Australia (ARIA) | 91 |- |- ! scope="row"| Ireland (IRMA) | 76 |- ! scope="row"| Lithuania (AGATA) | 70 |- ! scope="row"| New Zealand Hot Singles (RMNZ) | 6 |- |- |- |- |- |- |- ! scope="row"| US Rolling Stone Top 100 | 9 |} ==References== Category:2019 singles Category:2019 songs Category:Rick Ross songs Category:Drake (musician) songs Category:Songs written by Rick Ross Category:Songs written by Drake (musician) Category:Songs written by Vinylz Category:Songs written by Leon Thomas III Category:Songs written by OZ (record producer) Category:Music videos directed by Colin Tilley
title: Gold Roses
